message_1: Consider the topological space (X, τ), where X = {1, 2, 3} and τ = {∅, {1, 2, 3}, {1}, {1, 2}}. Determine whether the sequence (x_n) = {1, 1, 1, ...} converges to 1 in this topological space.
message_2:
To determine if the sequence (x_n) = {1, 1, 1, ...} converges to 1 in the topological space (X, τ), we need to check if for every open set U containing 1, there exists a natural number N such that for all n ≥ N, x_n ∈ U.

Let U be an open set containing 1. Since τ = {∅, {1, 2, 3}, {1}, {1, 2}}, the possible open sets containing 1 are {1, 2, 3} and {1}.

Case 1: U = {1, 2, 3}
In this case, for all n, x_n = 1 ∈ U. So, for any N, if n ≥ N, x_n ∈ U.

Case 2: U = {1}
In this case, for all n, x_n = 1 ∈ U. So, for any N, if n ≥ N, x_n ∈ U.

In both cases, we can find a natural number N such that for all n ≥ N, x_n ∈ U. Therefore, the sequence (x_n) = {1, 1, 1, ...} converges to 1 in the topological space (X, τ).
